Circus. Anna wanted to go to the circus. She bought a ticket and made her way to the ticket office. There, she purchased a ticket and then waited anxiously. Finally, she got her money's worth and was allowed inside the tent. Anna had a great time at the circus.

The Music Lover. Katherine wanted to be a musician. She'd never played an instrument before, but she was determined to learn. She practiced for hours every day until she was an expert. She performed in front of the whole school and got first place. Now Katherine is a well-known musician and she is happy.
Old Dog. Sam was walking to work. He passed an old dog on the side of the road. Sam stopped to pet the dog. The dog licked Sam's face. Sam didn't feel so guilty after that.

Ice Cream Truck. I bought ice cream from an ice cream truck. I walked by it once every day. It stopped in the middle of the street. I heard an ice cream truck next to the ice cream truck. I got my ice cream from that truck.

Skating Lessons. Ava was determined to become a skater. She went to a skating rink and asked to take lessons. She was nervous and didn't know how to skate. The instructor helped her get comfortable on the skateboard. Ava eventually improved her skills and had fun skating.
Gambler. John was a gambler. One day he was very lucky. He won a lot of money. John invested the money into his future. He went and won more money.
The Jail. Tom was in jail. He was getting hungry. The food in his cell was horrible. He decided to get better food. Tom managed to get better food and was able to enjoy it.

Talk. When my mom moved out I was very lonely. I was happy to have a companion but I was too tired of being alone. I tried to be a good listener but it didn't work. I talked so much about myself that no one cared about me. I learned to be a good listener from my mom.
bag. John and I were shopping. We were going to buy some food together. So John picks up a large bag of chips. I tell him not to eat too many. He agrees and we eat together.
Starbucks Wi-Fi. I went to Starbucks yesterday. I was hoping to get wifi. When I got there I was very disappointed. They had no wifi. I had to go back home.
Doll Show. Tom was a really big collector of dolls. He was at a big toy store. A lot of the dolls were for kids. Tom's favorite was an Elmo doll. Tom brought the doll home and gave it to his sister.
Personal Dignity. Jane was a tough worker. She didn't give up easily. One day Jane was told she was being let go. Jane was upset but decided she would be OK. She was very thankful for that.

Boredom Sets In. I got up at six this morning. I had to get to work today. I took a taxi to work. On the way to work I got stuck in traffic. The ride was so long that I had to stop at a restaurant for breakfast.

Push on the Swings. The kids were playing outside. The swings were up high and they wanted to swing. The dad pushed on the swing to make it go higher. The swing went higher and higher and the kids were very excited. The swing was so high they could see the city all around them.
Fixing my car. My car needed a new transmission fluid. I decided to call a repairman. He came right to my house. He replaced my fluid for me. I drove home happy.
Yancy. Yancy always wanted to be a famous singer. But he never got anywhere close. Then he took a trip to Los Angeles. Yancy heard some great bands playing. He thought he could fit in very well.

Broken mug. Lucy was having a mug made. Her favorite color was blue. She put the mug in the cabinet to make it a dark color. The mug didn't match the color of the room. The mug broke on the second day.

Doing laundry. Ivy did laundry last week. She put white clothes in her machine. Then she put blue clothes in her machine. Ivy was sure her clothes wouldn't mix. But luckily, Ivy's whites came out clean and shiny!
Car wash. Tina wanted a new car. So she decided to get one. She did an online car wash. After it was washed she drove it home. And it was perfect.

Henry Bear's Park. A boy found a stuffed bear in a park. The boy thought the bear was really cool. He played with it all afternoon. His mother told him it was for a toy. He thanked his mother and put the bear in a box.

Chloe gets a haircut. Chloe was a very pretty blonde girl. She had long blonde hair that was really long. Chloe decided to get a short haircut. Chloe went to the local barber shop to get her haircut. Chloe loved the cut and it made her hair look much shorter.

The Movies. A man was watching the new Batman movie. He had his parents pick him up from the movies. They went to the theater and bought popcorn. The man sat down with his friends to watch the movie. The movie was good and the man's parents were happy.

So What's With Coffee Anyway?. I always hated how jolly coffee sounds. My mother said I couldn't have it, but she'd only serve me one sip. So I went downstairs, where my mother was standing at the bar. She said she'd never had it and had a great time, as always. I left, not knowing what else to have to drink.

Faded Jeans. Joe bought a new pair of jeans. He wore them to a dance club one night. When they came out he got a lot of attention. Joe's friend saw the jeans in his reflection and offered to trade them. Joe got his new jeans from his friend and felt happy.

The Ice Cream. Jake went to buy ice cream. He saw a man outside with a basket. Jake bought his ice cream. The man got out a cup and put some in his basket. Jake loved the ice cream and thanked the man for it.

Nap Mistake. My friends and I went to the store to buy candy. We had lots of different kinds of candies in our bags. As we were walking to our car the store closed for a day. When we got back to the house there was no candy. We had to go to a different store to buy more candy.

Piano. My friends and I wanted to play a game of tennis. We each brought a different controller. We would then attempt to play tennis with each other. I lost my first game and had to go back to playing. It was one of the best games I ever played.

Lucky Penny. Kia had just won $1 at a trivia contest. She was so proud, she decided to wear her lucky penny to the game. At first she had trouble matching the answers. She did not win any prizes, but still had a great time! Kia's lucky penny inspired her to enter trivia again.
The Speakers. Paul was going to a concert. He wanted a good pair of speakers. He went to the electronics store. He bought the speakers he wanted. He brought them home and installed them.
The Garden. Joe worked in a garden. He planted many new flowers. One day, he forgot to water the garden. Joe had a bad smell. He went home and washed it off.

The Friend Fight. Dana hated being friends with Carla. However, Dana was afraid of getting in trouble. He was always talking to Carla. He knew he should be more honest with her about this. Dana learned to be more open about his friends.
Sleepy Cat. Nate took a nap in his bed. But he woke up with a very angry cat. He tried to go back to sleep. But the cat kept making loud noises. Nate yelled at the cat.

bottles. My wife does not like going to the store. Sometimes she will only buy bottled water. Yesterday, she bought an iced tea. I said I would buy her one today. We left for work, only to find out it was hot outside.

Bananas. One day, a little girl was wandering outside. She picked up a banana and threw it at me. It landed in the bushes, and the little girl found it. She ran back inside and put the banana in the fridge. It turned out to be very old, but I liked the banana so much.

Mother's Day Cruise. The Smith family always wanted to go on a cruise. This year, their mom surprised them with a cruise. On the cruise, they played lots of games. They even went to the beach to relax. The Smiths had a great time on the cruise!

Regrets. Molly wanted to play basketball with her friends. Molly decided to go to the basketball court. Molly did not realize that the basketball court was in a storm. The thundering wind blew sand on Molly's feet. Molly decided to stay at home.
Tight Shoes. Tom was running barefoot. He put on a pair of running shoes. They felt very restrictive. Tom tried to walk barefoot without pain. He was unable to do so.

Christmas time. This year is the first year my mom does not buy gifts. It's a bit odd but she still loves Christmas. The only thing we do not get this year is gifts. Christmas morning my mom brings me some chocolate bunnies. She is going to surprise me this year.

Beads, Beads, Everywhere. I was walking down the road when I saw a girl staring at my shoes. I froze in fear, expecting some sort of situation. Then, I heard a weird noise and realized it was a mouse! I screamed and ran as fast as I could. I got home and decided to be more cautious next time.

Pizza. My daughter loves Pizza. She begged her parents for it when they first met her. They told her it was just a tradition and she would never get it. The pizza place had closed a few weeks ago. They offered to pay for the pizza to be delivered to her.

Good Spot. Nancy bought some new makeup. She put on the foundation and put on blush. She thought she looked great. However, a coworker told her she looked bad. She told her she needed to be more natural.

Cartoons. Joe liked to watch cartoons. He was playing in the driveway when his dad came running. His dad asked him what was wrong and Joe was yelling. His dad told him that the television was not plugged in. Joe was grounded for a week.

My New Puppy. When I got my first puppy I had no idea what I wanted. He was small and brown. I begged my parents to buy him a toy boat, but they said no. I decided to do something very creative. I painted him with a yellow boat and he loved it!
Tennis. Tim loved playing tennis. He decided to become good at it. Tim entered a local tournament. He did really well. Tim made it to the finals and won.
Movie. Dan wanted to watch a movie. Dan called the movie theater. The theater did not have any showing dates. Dan checked the library computer system. The computer was out of date.
Grumpy. The woman was grumpy. She threw a fit. Her husband complained to the boss. The boss fired the woman. The woman was happy to be free of the grumpy woman.

Age Difference. I met a girl named Lisa today. I have been married for 40 years to a man named Bill. We are far apart in age, so I was concerned. I asked Lisa how her parents were feeling about her being single. Lisa told me they were very happy for her, and that she loved them.

What to do. Tom was sick of spending time alone. He wanted to make new friends. He decided to try out for his school's football team. It was tough going from just getting out of his room everyday to playing. Tom was glad he made some friends on the team.
Summer Job. John needed to make some extra money. So he applied for summer work. He applied for work near the beach. He was offered the job of his dreams. John got to work in the sun every day.

Mints. Kia was on a road trip in the South. She was in a van with her boyfriend. She had bought a new set of bottles. They had gotten some mint flavored ones. Kia was very happy with the bottle selection.

Bad ice cream. We went out to eat ice cream one night. The ice cream store was having a contest. Whoever made the best ice cream won the contest. My mom bought me a flavor. It tasted disgusting and I cried in the car.

Riding a Bike Drunk. Trent was riding his bike down a hill. A car appeared and slammed on his brakes. Trent yelled as loud as he could. A cop pulled up to the scene. Trent was charged with public intoxication.

Kris' Kids' Christmas List. Kris wanted to write a list of things to buy for his kids. He bought all sorts of food but none for the kids. Kris decided to get the kids the Christmas list instead. They were very thankful for the list and bought everything they asked for. Kris was very happy about his purchase of a list for the kids.

Family Picture. Lila had always wanted to take a family picture with her family. She invited her sisters and her cousins to take pictures. She made reservations for the family at a local restaurant. The next morning, she woke up early to set up. She took a picture of the family at the family picnic in the park.
Mop. Gina's mother had given her a mop. She would clean and mop the whole house. Now it was time for a change. Gina looked at the old mop and sighed. Her grandma's mop was much dirtier and dusty.

Dairy Diary. Shelly's mom told her that she could start a diary. Shelly wrote down all of her adventures with her dad. One day, she got home and her mom caught her. Her dad was grounded for not telling her about the diary. Shelly was very sad because her diary was ruined.
Rain. It was raining when I walked into the car. I didn't have a umbrella with me. I started to take off my shoes in the rain. My phone fell out of my pocket. It dropped to the ground, soaking wet.

The free seasonings. Juan and his family were on vacation in Mexico. They were having a great time eating tacos and playing games. They got some food at a stand and went to go eat. The cashier told them they could get free seasonings. Juan happily thanked her and took some home.

The Circus. My niece took my two year old to the circus. I was worried that he would not like the clowns. But, he loved all of them! The clowns yelled and laughed. My niece said that clowns are funny.

The Trampoline. Tim was riding a trampoline with friends. Tim fell down on one of the legs. The legs were broken. Tim had to wear a cast for the rest of the year. Tim could not jump on the trampoline again for at least a month.

Larry's car smokes. Larry was driving down the road. A strong smell from his car started coming from his engine. Larry went out of his car to investigate. He looked inside and saw smoke coming from his engine. Larry called Triple A to tell them his car was broken.

Sunk. My friend Tony and I were talking. Tony suggested we go snorkeling. We went snorkeling on the Caribbean island. We had a great time looking at the beautiful fish. I really enjoyed the snorkeling experience.

Ebay Scam. A person posted a link to an item on ebay. The buyer responded and said that he loved the item. He made good offers for the item. The seller then responded. He gave up and posted the item for sale.

The Drag Race. Tom decided to go to a drag race. He didn't know anyone but wanted to impress everyone. He got his friends together for the event. Everyone got on their bikes and ran to the starting line. Tom finished third in the race.

Car Wash. My car has been covered in mud for the past week. Today I took it to the car wash. It took me half an hour to get my car clean. It only cost me $10 for the car wash. I feel better knowing that my car is clean now.

The blanket over the head. It was time for the kids to go to bed. All the kids climbed into the blankets. The blanket was wet and cold. The kids were cold for the first time that week. The blankets were wet, and the kids slept cold.

The Heavy Pizza. Tara was hosting a Thanksgiving party. She was trying to cook some pizza. Unfortunately, she over boiled the dough. All the pizzas were burnt. Tara had to replace the pizzas with similar sized pizzas.

The Son. Jim was playing in his backyard. He found a tennis ball on the ground. He picked it up and started to toss it around. The ball ended up hitting his neighbor's house. His neighbor woke up to the noise of a tennis ball hitting her house.
Seth gets a girl. Seth wanted a girlfriend. He asked a girl at school. He tried to talk to her. He was too shy. The girl rejected Seth.
The Nest. The boy found a nest outside. He put a stick in the nest. The nest started to crawl. The boy climbed up the tree. The nest fell in.
Zoned Out. She didn't know where to zone out to be. She was on her way to meet her friends. She tried using some of the apps on her phone. None of them worked. She couldn't find a good spot.

A Cat for Mom. One day, a little boy named Timmy had a kitten. Timmy's mother wasn't sure she wanted a cat. Timmy begged for a cat for every day after school. His mother finally said yes to a cat for Timmy. The two went to the shelter together to adopt a new furry friend.
Basement. My garage is filled with junk. I decided to clean it up. I got a plunger and began to pull the junk out. I picked up everything and threw it away. Now my garage is looking good again.

Try Hard. Kate's mom wanted to get her a car for Christmas. Kate's dad had a hard time getting her to buy one. They kept putting off Christmas until December. On Christmas day, Kate's mom bought the car. Kate was so excited when she got home from school.
story. Joe had a story to tell. He decided to write about it. After days of work, he finished the story. He sent the story to his boss. His boss was very impressed.
Mini golfing. Fred went golfing with his friends. He played with his friends for hours. Then they played mini golf. The friends were better than Fred. Fred said he would play with them again.

The Mountain Lion. Dan was walking on a trail. He saw a mountain lion in the distance. The mountain lion charged at Dan and he was frightened. Dan got away quickly and called for his friends. The people chased the mountain lion down.

Jackson is a star. Jackson loves to sing. One day he decides to make a living from his singing. Jackson goes to a singing contest. He wins the contest and makes it a part time job. Now Jackson is a huge superstar.
November. My dog died November 2nd. The vet said my wife was allergic. I had to go to the ER. I had trouble breathing. My wife had to take medicine to help me.

Snorkeling Trip. Liz was very excited to go snorkeling. She booked a trip to California with friends. When she got there, she didn't know what to expect. It was beautiful! She couldn't believe her eyes.

Puppy Training. Jake's puppy was so big he could hardly carry it. He had to teach him how to walk and how to sit and how to turn. But he knew his puppy wouldn't hurt him if he didn't. He took his puppy to a walking and talking dog training class. His puppy learned how to walk and turn and Jake's dog was happy again!

Roy's Big Move. Roy is retiring from the police force. He is planning to move to Texas. His big move will be very disruptive to his family and friends. However, Roy feels his time as a police officer is best suited for Texas. Now that Roy is free to move where he wants, he has plans to do it right.

New Kid. I moved to a new town a few weeks ago. It's been hard to make friends. I started at the very first restaurant I could find. Alas, a lot of the restaurants there are also run down and expensive. I'm going to a Chinese restaurant tomorrow night.

Worry About Others Or Myself. Jasmine felt very sad about the death of her husband. When he passed away, she was very upset that he died. However, she wanted to move on. Jasmine decided that it would be best if she moved on. Jasmine was very happy when she was able to move on.

Looking. I used to work as a graphic designer. One day my boss sent me a request for a new design. I decided to make a website for him. It took months to make a website. Now he uses my website to send me design requests!

Engineer. Hazel had a dream of being an engineer. She knew she was going to college in the fall. However, she didn't feel like going to college. Her mother was very upset with her. Finally Hazel gave in and went to college.

Ship Your Car. I was driving my new car to work one day. But I realized I'd left my keys in my car. I left my car unlocked while I shopped for groceries. And someone stole my car after leaving it unlocked. But that person apologized when they realized they had left their keys.

Playing at the Beach. The family went to the beach. They loaded up the car with their gear. The car took off and parked at the beach. They packed sandwiches and towels for the beach. They set up their beach chairs and umbrellas.
The broken screen. Tina went to her computer. She was using her laptop to download some new games. Suddenly, her laptop shut off. Tina was disappointed. She could have let it restart and continue.

Snorkeling. Annie saw a huge cloud above her. She put on a life jacket and went snorkeling. She saw a baby dolphin in the water. She smiled as she watched the creature swim by. She watched it for a while longer and felt sad for the rest of the day.
Pay. Tim had to make a payment. He put in his payment online. He waited for it to get processed. A few days later he got an email. It was his credit card balance refunded.
The Vase. The kids played in their living room. They saw an old vase in the corner. It was cracked and dirty. They cleaned it up and put it back. They couldn't wait to show it to their friends!
The Ship. The captain took his men to the bow of the ship. They saw the ship from the water. The men boarded the ship. The captain was in charge. The men all felt secure on the ship.

No More Beard. Ralph had a beard for years. His wife always told him he needed to shave it. He finally decided to shave his beard. He loved how much he looked different without having to shave it. He is glad that he shaved his beard.
The Blanket. Anna had been freezing. She decided to make a blanket. She carefully laid out all her blankets. Then she tied them up. She was ready to take a nap.

Thanksgiving Dinner. It was finally time for Thanksgiving and Jim's mom wanted to cook. She got her turkey ready and the other items ready. Her son was not feeling well so she let him go. As soon as he came back she made dinner. His family was very thankful for his good attitude.

The Tree. One day Bob and his mother went to buy some Christmas tree. They found a beautiful one. They wanted to have it put in the living room. They got a ladder and put it in the living room. Then they decorated the tree.

Subscription. John got a subscription to a magazine. He thought he would get it every month. However, it got really slow. John asked his subscription service about the subscription. They told him they were having trouble.

Friend's bicycle. Tom had a friend over for dinner. They were planning to ride a bicycle. Tom's friend was too nervous to ride. Tom offered to ride with him. Tom's friend rode very well, and Tom was glad he helped.
Muscle. The man lifted a lot of weights. He wanted to be strong. He found a trainer to help. The trainer helped the man with his goals. The man was stronger after the trainer's help.

Illness. Jill suffered from headaches a lot lately. She decided to see the doctor. Her doctor said she was having a brain tumor and gave her pills. She took the pills and felt much better. Jill finally felt well again.

Chekhov's Warning. Czar took up studying the works of Chekhov. He liked to imagine that he was one of the villains in his novels. He became very interested in Chekhov's life. He read all his works. Now Chekhov is an icon in the Russian novel.

Joe's Cars. Joe loved classic cars. He saved up his money for several years. One day he decided to buy an old muscle car. He saved the money until he had enough money. Joe drove his old muscle car for many years.

Bad Kids. Joey and his friends were in a band. Their friend, Donny, wanted to make them famous. Donny joined Joey and his friends at a bar. Joey and his friends decided to quit their band. Joey and his friends were in a bad band from that night on.

Plants. Bob wanted to buy some plants. He went to a plant nursery and bought some seeds. He went home and planted the seeds. He watered them everyday and they grew into plants. Bob was very happy with his garden.
Lost Bird. Ike went on a walk one day. He noticed a bird in a tree. He got closer and read it's name. The name was Bob. Ike named the bird Bob and kept him on a string for a long time.

Class Reunion. Gina's high school class reunion was this Saturday. She went online to research class dates and locations. She did not find any dates that she could attend. Gina decided to drive to the mall instead. Gina arrived to the reunion a half hour early.

Presidential Vote. When I got up to cast my vote in the presidential election, I was nervous. I knew I had to do the right thing, but had never voted before. As the votes were cast, I felt like I was walking on an invisible line. Then, when I saw that I had voted for the candidate I liked the most. I felt so much more confident afterwards that I did my best.
The Hot Springs. The family was camping. They discovered a hot springs. They wanted to visit them often. The family spent all day swimming in them. It felt so much better after.

The Topiary. Jim's cat would always climb to the top of his porch. It was a great place for catnip to climb up. One day Jim's cat climbed all the way down. Jim had to climb his catnip as well. His cat jumped up, and Jim was so proud of his work!

Japan. Ida wanted to take a vacation. She knew that a trip to Japan was expensive. Then she decided to save her money. She started saving for two months. In two months, Ida had enough money for her trip!

Angel has sex. Angel is having her first sexual experience. She is having a very good time. Suddenly she feels a sharp pain. She realizes she has a broken condom. She tells her parents and they are so worried for her.
craft. The man gathered some materials. He crafted a craft. His wife found it interesting. She commented on how good it was. The man was very happy.

The Embarrassed Girlfriend. Kate's boyfriend was at the bar. The friend she had been dating wasn't with her. Kate was upset but the friend explained the situation. Kate was embarrassed she was alone with him after so long. She felt she could handle it and go home to relax.

New Dress. Kim went to the store for a new dress. When she walked into the store the dress was on display. Kim was upset the dress was no longer on display. Kim told the manager of the store. The manager gave Kim a new dress.
Pumpkin Smashing. One day I decided to make a pumpkin pie. The pie tasted terrible. My dad told me I needed to chill the pie first. I froze the pie first. It tasted better after I chill the pie.

Bubbles. I like the smell of bubble tea. One day I went to the kitchen and poured some into my mug. I smelled a little bubble when I opened the cap. I grabbed the bag and took a big sip. I decided I would like to try the bubble tea again.

No Ride. The Smiths were out on a road trip. They had to make a choice. They could ride to a restaurant that was two hours away. They decided to take a bus instead. The bus was a good idea and they enjoyed the trip.

A Jump Start. I had been out all day and was very tired. I finally decided to go back to sleep. When I woke up I realized I had been late for work! I decided to jump start my car and hurry home. My boss was impressed when I got to work on time.

Acknowledge. My girlfriend and I have been fighting recently. I decided to send her an email of thanks. However, I did not send her a thank you email. So I decided to send her a text message thanking her for her support. Luckily, she was so touched by the text message that she accepted.

Dried lake. Last week my wife went to a lake. She got there early to swim in the cold water. There was a ton of algae growing in the lake. It was very unpleasant to swim in. She will not go back to that lake ever again.

Kids. Sylvia and Charles were best friends. They would spend all day in the yard playing ball. One day Charles and Sylvia decided they wanted to start a band. They practiced and wrote songs for hours and hours. They played their first gig on Saturday night.

A Friend Indeed. One day I was at the corner with my friends. A woman came up to me asking for a ride to the store. I asked if she could pick me up. She agreed to do so. I got her a ride and we ended up seeing a movie.

Lost Homework. Ivan and his friends were working on homework. He was in a group project and was in charge of organizing. Suddenly, his phone rang. He got distracted and missed a call from his friend. When Ivan realized he was late he made sure he got his homework.

The Disgusting Pie. Molly was baking a pie. She added all of the ingredients to a stand mixer. Then, she slowly mixed the ingredients. Then, she put the pie in to bake. When it was ready, she tasted it and realized it was gross.

Down we go. Amy's friends were having a sleep over. They decided to go on a long hike. When it got dark they got in the car to go. They drove for a very long time. When they arrived they were exhausted but happy.
Drove. Joe was late to work. His boss told him to get to work. He drove to work. When Joe arrived his boss told him to go home. Joe was told that his late was unacceptable.

Choosing Just One. Amy was excited to go to the zoo this weekend. She took a ride in the elephant carousel and saw many colorful elephants. She rode on the water slide down to the water park. Then she chose one of the elephant sculptures and took pictures. Amy was happy with her decision to visit the zoo.

Stained Pants. Sally's favorite shirt was green. She usually wore them even when she was not wearing them. One day Sally was not wearing any green. Her shirt was all over her pants. She had a big green stain on her pants.
Ordering a pizza. Lisa wanted pizza. She called the restaurant to order it. When she picked it up they told her it was not ready. She was furious. Lisa hung up the phone.

My Little Helper. I was walking my dog one morning. A dog had fallen from a tree and was stuck. I quickly climbed to the top of a nearby tree. I gently pulled the dog out from under the tree. I then helped him down from the tree safely.

The Tea Pot. Lori's favorite gift was a new tea pot. She brought it to work every day. When her coworkers tried it, they loved it. But, one day they didn't want to buy it anymore. So Lori brought it back to the store, but they didn't buy it.

A day at the golf course. Today I went to the golf course to play some golf. I had to get there early so I could get my tee time. I walked up to the golf cart and took it out. Once there I put my feet down and began to swing. I hit my first golf ball and was very happy!

Military Veteran Tells A Story. John enlisted in the army when he was 18 years old. John spent every day of his 18 months in the military. John was sent overseas to Afghanistan where he was injured. While there, he was in a helicopter crash that took him to a hospital. John was flown to the hospital in Boston to receive treatment.
Hunting. The man went hunting. He found a deer. He tried to shoot it. He missed. He went home with no deer meat.
Braces. He had crooked teeth. His mom said he couldn't wear braces. So she made him put some. Her mom had to pull it out at her end. He got braces that day.
Morning Noise. My mom woke me up this morning to my room. I was not ready to go. The noise woke up my sister. We had to go downstairs. We were both so scared.
Birthday Cake. My wife made a birthday cake for her niece. She bought the best cakes. The cake was blue with red icing. She decorated the cake with candles. We ate the cake on her birthday.
Nice tip. Allie needed a new dress. She really needed a blue dress. So she went to the store and got some. When she got back she was shocked. The cashier had given her a large tip.

Hotel Surprise. Kelli was staying at a luxury hotel. She was so excited to see how much fun she had in the city. She wanted to see the sights. Kelli ended up spending the entire week partying and having fun. Unfortunately she had a terrible accident while she was out partying.

The Dog That Did Not Bark. A dog sat by the fence at the dog park. One day a man walked by and asked what was up. The dog didn't respond, but the man thought it might be hungry. The dog did not bark so the man took it home. The dog ate all the leftover food the dog brought home.

The Accident. Ethan was driving to work on Tuesday. While on the road he hit a patch of ice. He was unable to stop in time and slid across the highway. He had to call triple A for help. Thankfully no one was injured, and Ethan was okay.

The Chess grandmaster. Kai was a skilled chess player. He practiced everyday on his game. One day, he entered the chess tournament. He was able to beat all of his opponents. His performance was praised by the chess tournament judges.

The Argument. James and his mom got into an argument. He told her he'd rather go to a nice restaurant. His mom refused to go to a nice restaurant. She went to the store to buy food. James and his mom got in trouble at the store.

Losing a sister. When I was little, I went to a friend's house. We all play video games together. Suddenly, my little sister runs off! I chase after her, but I can't catch her. She falls down a block, and breaks her hip.

A Bear in Camp. One day, James took his family camping. They set up the tent and a fire. James and his family decided to take a hike in the woods. A bear came out of the woods and attacked James and his family. They all hiked back home, but James never forgot to lock his tent.

Tomato. Bill was working as a chef. He wanted to grow tomatoes for his customers. He went to the market and bought many types. He planted them all and then waited. They did not grow but he kept the tomatoes.
Siren. The man heard the siren. He pulled over to the side of the road. He told the police he saw a deer. The police drove by without stopping. The man felt better when he stopped to check.

Riding a Bike. Sam bought a new bike. He had it for a few weeks. He decided to teach his friends how to ride it. Sam took them out and had a lot of fun. His friends were very thankful and learned to ride too.

Bad Vacation. Dan went on a vacation to the Caribbean. While there, Dan took a wrong turn and wound up in Mexico. While there, Dan met an old friend who moved away for a job. He couldn't stop thinking about the guy. Dan decided he would never go on a vacation to the Caribbean again.

Language. Eve wanted to learn a new language. She was having trouble with her Spanish. She was so frustrated that she decided to hire a tutor. Eve was very happy to find someone to help her learn Spanish. She was very happy that she didn't have to worry about her Spanish anymore.

Very First Basketball Game. Cindy was nervous about her first basketball game. She did not have any friends to play with. Cindy tried to cheer herself up with some friends. The game started and Cindy did a great job. Everyone cheered Cindy up during the game.

Dance Like You Mean It. Dan was a great dancer. He worked hard at his routine. The school talent show was coming up. Dan felt that he was ready for his turn. Dan performed flawlessly in front of the whole school.

Snake At The Zoo. Molly wanted to take her child to the zoo. Molly searched the zoo for the animals. Molly found a snake in the reptile house. Molly took her child to the snake house. She took her child to see all the animals.

Stuffed Animal. Jim was very hungry. Jim decided to eat a small snack. Jim ate a small bag of popcorn and a small soft drink. Afterwards, Jim got up and left the house. After returning, Jim realized he ate too much food.
Hockey. Tom was a great hockey player. He practiced for hours every day. His coach knew he was a great player. He asked Tom to try out for the team. Tom was happy to be on the team.
Softball Game. Tim was playing softball with his friend. Tim's team had a few more at bat. Tim had to hit home runs to win. Tim hit home runs for his team to win. Tim's team was happy with Tim.
jelly. I went to a party. My friend and I were playing football. I felt my stomach hurt. I went home and ate some jelly. It tasted so good!
Boxing Match. I've always been a boxer. I've never boxed in my life. My first fight was a knock out. I realized that boxing wasn't for me. I stopped boxing and I became a cheerleader instead.

Breakup. Bill and Kim had been dating for two years. Kim noticed Bill had been neglecting her. She took the relationship into her own hands. She told him she wanted to break it up. Bill broke up with Kim the next day.

Fear of Alleys. Jenny's car was stuck in an alley. There were no cars around. She pulled over and called a tow truck. The tow truck arrived and began to unload her car. Jenny freaked out and screamed at the driver when he didn't arrive.

Suspect. Suspect was a very small kitten who followed her owner around. One day Suspect's owner took her for a walk, and saw her. Suspect's owner noticed that Suspect was looking for food, and brought it to her. Suspect's owner began feeding the little kitten and asked what her problem was. Suspect's owner told her the food was not for her and the kitten became frightened.

Building Laws. Tim hated how expensive cities are. So he decided to move to a small town. He didn't realize how expensive it would be to live there. So Tim quit his job and became an entrepreneur. He's now building a city with his own hands.

Trick or Treat. Billy had a huge Halloween party for trick or treating with his friends. There were lots of spooky houses. He went down to the haunted house alone. When Billy saw his neighbor, he was scared. Billy was happy when his neighbor joined him.
Chicken is good. Yesterday I decided to make chicken. I had never made chicken before. It was very easy to make. The chicken turned out great. It was so good I decided to make it again.

The Pudding. Kathy was a great cook. Her family was making dinner one day. They all had a lot of mashed potatoes to make. Kathy made the best pudding they had ever tasted. They all couldn't wait to eat it!
A New Car!. Tom wanted a new car. He saved up for months. He finally had enough money. Tom went to the dealership and bought his dream car! He loved his new car very much.
Old Speakers. Tom bought a new pair of speakers. The speakers looked good. After a while he noticed it wasn't the same. They started to sound like cardboard. Tom had to throw them out.

Michigan Trip. Today was Tom's first trip to Michigan. He was excited and nervous to go in. When Tom got to the park, he was immediately greeted by a sign. Tom walked over and signed for a huge festival. He got to meet a lot of people that he had never met before.

Notices. Amy's mom went to work. She left Amy and her siblings alone in the house. She saw a text message on the kitchen table. She went to ask her sister what the message was. Her sister told her it was from Amy's crush Ray.
Christmas party. Beth was invited to a Christmas party. She was excited. But unfortunately she got a flu. Beth had to cancel. She was sad about it.

Large TV. Tom always watched big screens. He was watching his favorite show on netflix. His roommates thought it was funny to make fun of him. Tom got angry and smashed the tv. His roommates never made fun of him again.
Tofu. I wanted to eat some tofu. So I got out my knife. I cut into the tofu. It was delicious. I decided to eat more tofu.

prison. Bob was very lonely in prison. He felt very alone and even a little bit scared. Bob made a plan. He put a gun up and asked for help. He was able to escape from prison thanks to the help of a friend.

Sleep. I went out for a jog last night. I wasn't sure how tired I was going to be. At about 5:30 in the evening I decided to go home. As I started to walk home, I fell asleep. I slept right through my alarm!

Attitude. Sam's family was very strict. They didn't allow Sammy to make too many mistakes in school. One day, Sam had to take an anatomy test and forgot his pencil. When he arrived to take the test, it was very easy. Sam made a C on the test because he remembered to bring his pencil.
girlfriend. She decided to introduce me to her friends. But they started to bully me. They picked a fight with me. They ended up throwing me on the ground. I learned a lesson.

Jim's Nice. Jim had a nice car. He never thought to ask for a part time job. He was offered a part time job working in a coffee shop. Jim reluctantly accepted the job. Now he's making enough to pay off his car.
Wet Boots. Jim was going for a run. He didn't realize the water was so deep. Jim's boots got soaked. He tried to dry them in the sun. Unfortunately that didn't work and his boots became soaked.

Ball Game. Jake loved baseball and was rooting for his team. They were up by 2 runs and Jake was nervous about it. Jake's team ended up winning and Jake was elated. He got out of his seat and celebrated with his team. It was a fun night and Jake was happy for the win.

Stripes. Kate was painting her living room. She wanted something to put a picture on. She couldn't decide what color to paint. Then she realized she could put stripes on both sides. She picked out some blue and pink stripes.

Lunch. It was late at night and Gina was hungry. But she had no money to go out and eat. She decided to make her own lunch instead. She got a can of soup from the pantry and made some sandwich. When she ate her sandwich, Gina was very happy and full.
Snowstorm 5. I woke up to a cold snow storm last week. We stayed inside for a long time. When the storm ended we were freezing. The next morning it was cold again. Now I have an open window.
diving. Jim was always afraid of heights. He had never jumped out of a plane, though. He was about to go skydiving. Jim got to the edge of the airplane. He jumped out and didn't even cry.

Blown Surprise. Bob was watching the news. He learned that there had been a large terrorist attack in his city. He was furious at the news. He immediately went to the grocery store. He bought some canned goods, and prayed for the safety of his home.

Loud Birds. There was a loud noise in the attic. I went to look for it but didn't see anything. Later, I heard a loud thud at the bottom of the stairs. I ran to see what it was and saw something white under a sheet. My dog had stepped on it and the sound was painful.

The tribe. The tribe was meeting to discuss a new project. They had been given the task of creating a new language. The tribe gathered at a meeting place. They set out the language and the rules of the tribe. The tribe had a great time at the meeting.

Disappearing Bagels. I used to make bagels everyday. I would put everything on one layer of paper. I would then fold the paper and fold it again. Then, I would fold the paper again and make the bagels. The bagels looked good and they were satisfying to eat.
Larry passes on. Larry felt sick. He did not know what to do. Larry called 911. He told them he had a heart attack. Larry died that night.

Temptation. Ivy's boyfriend's brother bought her a vibrator for her birthday. He promised he would never let her use it. But Ivy was tempted to use it. She secretly put it in her mouth and swallowed. The vibrator's power was too much for Ivy!

No Fork. Jane was cutting vegetables in her new garden. She needed some forks to help with the process. Unfortunately she had none. Jane realized she needed to buy some extra forks. Jane went to the store and purchased some extra forks.

Eating Fish. My boyfriend and I went to a sushi bar. It was not sushi per se. We had salmon, avocado, tuna, and lots of other fish. We tried many different types of sushi. It was the best food we ate all day.

Emily Visits France. Emily has always wanted to visit France. Emily and her family decide to travel to Paris. Upon arrival, Emily learns the language. Emily visits the Louvre museum. She returns home with a whole new appreciation for France.
poison ivy. Dani came inside. She thought it was okay at first. Then, she realized that it was ivy! Dani tried to swat it off. The ivy went away in no time.
Safe Water. The water in the sink was leaking. Tim was worried about his water. He called his electrician. The electrician came right away. The water was fixed right away.

Breakdown. I was driving through the desert. I saw a truck that was backing up. I pulled over and asked if the truck was OK. The driver told me he ran out of gas. I fixed his engine and he was on his way.

Coffee. Nancy wanted a caffeine-free diet. But she feared the coffee would make her sleepy. Finally she opted for decaffeinated coffee. She took the first sip and found it delicious! Now she loves caffeine free coffee every day!
Carpenter. I am looking for a new job. I am taking a carpenter's class. I am going to learn carpentry. I am nervous about learning carpentry. I have a hard time learning carpentry.

Diet. Mary has a big dinner. She really wants to eat her favorite meal. She goes through the drive thru and orders a cheeseburger. The cheeseburger is a cheeseburger that has been patted down for extra bacon. Mary eats the cheeseburger while watching the football game.

The Puppet Show. Ariel loved puppet shows. She begged her mother for a puppet show, but her mother was allergic. On Christmas Eve, Ariel's mother came downstairs with the gifts. She was so excited when she saw Ariel's new puppet. Ariel and her mom were so excited for their new show, they cried.

Aquaman. There once was a man named Jason who had a problem. He didn't have any more money. He decided to take on a new job. He worked for a company that manufactured water bottles. Jason made more money than he ever thought possible!

Allie's birthday party. It was Allie's birthday and her family was out of town. She went to a local restaurant but they didn't have any presents. She asked her friends if they could make her a gift. They made her a beautiful cake and her birthday was an awesome one. She was so happy and thanked them for it.

tired. John woke up late for school. John went to the library and checked his email. John went to bed early. When he got to school, he waited at the front desk. John's parents said it was okay because he didn't stay up.

Mary rides the bus. Mary decided to take the bus home. She was walking home from school one day when she saw a homeless person. The man asked her for money and Mary was too scared to give it to him. Mary's mom drove the bus home. The man thanked Mary when she got home.

Late to Practice. I walked into the practice gymnasium in school. All the athletes were already running. I was waiting for my turn. I waited around for another thirty seconds. Finally, I ran into the locker room.

Bad Reaction. Jane was driving home with a friend. Her friend's phone was taking a ton of pictures. The phone kept snapping and vibrating. Jane was worried it was dead. The phone died so Jane had to stop.

Wrong Change. Tom didn't have much money. He decided to get a snack at the store. Tom was given a dollar bill for his selection. He went back to his car with the dollar bill. The cashier didn't recognize it.

Ouch. Bob's stomach hurt when he ate dinner. So he decided to make a change. He ate oatmeal everyday for breakfast. But the next day, his stomach hurt even worse. So he decided to drink milk instead of oatmeal.
Sandwich. I was starving. I decided to make myself a sandwich. I had avocado, ham, bacon and cheese on it. Alas, I ran out of mustard. So I had to get creative with mustard in my sandwich.

The Bus. The family was on a trip. They were going to a new city. The driver told the family it would be great to ride in a bus. The family decided to take the bus. They rode the bus through the city and had a great time.

The Cheater. My dad used to play golf at the family golf course. One day, my dad caught my dad playing golf at another family member's house. My dad confronted my dad and he admitted that he was cheating. I told my dad that my dad was a cheater and to get back at him. My dad got mad and went home, and he never spoke to me again.
The Dog Park. Tom was walking down the street. He noticed a dog park. Tom noticed the dog was allowed in the park. He saw the leash and picked up the dog. Tom took the dog home.

The Jester. One night, a little boy walked up to a window in my mom's house. The boy looked through the window. He saw someone running from the window. He ran out of the house and into the woods. When he got home, my mom let me sit on his bed.
Horses. I have been studying horses. They are a lot of work. I am getting ready for my first rodeo. I am very nervous, but excited. I am going to be so lucky to win some money!

Not Here. I was very upset when my neighbor called me. He wanted to know if I could pick his kids up. He asked me if I could bring his kids to his house. I was very upset and told him that I would not do that. He told me that he would give me $40 dollars if I would come.
Remorse. Tom was playing in his kitchen. His mom went to get him a bowl of soup. Tom didn't feel too guilty about eating soup. His mom took the soup away. Tom cried because he hated soup.

Ugly Picture. Tom always loved his girlfriend. He would always take pictures of her. He took several pictures of her. Tom tried to frame them but it wasn't enough. He took a picture of her shirtless in the bathroom.

John's Chip Dilemma. John loved to eat fried chicken, but he had never made it himself. One day, he made some fried chicken and tried it out. It was awful, so he went to the store to buy some other chicken. He bought a lot of fried chicken and learned how to make his own. John ended up making his own chicken and it turned out great!
Lunch box. Jim had lunch at the diner. He got a sandwich. Jim opened up the lunch box. Inside, there was a locket. Jim had the lunch of his life.

A life worth living. Lacey and Tim met through a dating site. After exchanging emails, they decided to meet for coffee. Tim felt a connection with Lacey, and they spent time together. They met each other's parents, and became best friends. Lacey and Tim decided to live a life worth living.

Leaving everything behind. John hated his job and hated how it had changed him. He thought that he could do something else with his life. But he didn't want to give up his job. John went to school to get a degree. He left everything behind, and now was the happiest man alive.

Low Bank Account. I opened up my bank account the other day. I had to go to the bank and make a withdrawal. While at the bank I forgot about my money. When I got home I realized that my bank account was empty. It took me a long time to think of a way to get my money.

Michelle's Dream. She wanted to become a ballerina. She was very tall and had long blonde hair. She practiced very hard. Her parents wanted her to take ballet but she was afraid. She worked hard and learned a lot and finally became a ballerina.

The house volunteer. Cathy's family was very poor. Cathy felt very sad when they found out about the shelter. She decided to volunteer and help with the children. When she got to work, she found a baby in need of a mother. Cathy decided she would help this child, and take care of her.
Sue Buys A Chair. Sue needs a new chair. She asks her dad to buy her one. Sue and her dad go shopping. They both agree on a nice leather. Sue loves her new chair.

plastic mold. My son came home from the hospital with plastic mold in his mouth. He was terrified. He asked me if I could get rid of the mold. I took it to a plastic mold disposal service. They put it out and he got over his fear.

Tight Fight. A man was fighting in his car. His tire popped and he couldn't see clearly. The man lost control of the car and it fell off the road. The man yelled for help and waited. An ambulance came and saved the man and the car.
Leftovers. Sandra made french fries for her family. They loved it. She had made a big batch at home. She forgot about them at all. Sandra was so sad because she never got to eat her fries.
Internet. Gina's phone couldn't connect to the internet. She pulled it from her pocket. She flipped it open to see what was wrong. She saw her screen was cracked. She fixed it on her way back.

Final Exam. My final exam is tomorrow. I'm not sure how I will study for this exam. I called my advisor to see what he could do. He suggested I contact some college professors. He also told me he would email me instructions for my exams.

Chemical. Bob wanted to try something new. He read online that some people claimed they could solve cancer. He read they claimed they would cure cancer. He read they were wrong. Bob decided he would stick to regular medicine.

Keeping Out Cold Drafts. My wife noticed the cold drafts often while she was pregnant. It started to affect her job performance. She decided to wear more layers and move to a warmer area. She moved to a warmer part of town. Now her job performance is better.

The pain. Lana felt a sharp pain in her shoulder. She realized it was pinching her nerves. She called her doctor and scheduled an exam. When she arrived at the doctor, they did an exam. The doctor did a bad job and Lana went home with a sprained shoulder.

Swimsuit. Nola was wearing a swimsuit. She wanted to wear it with shorts. Her mom explained she was already short. Nola got a bathing suit for next week. She was upset she couldn't wear her swimsuit any more.

Jim Waches His Brother Play Basketball. Jim and his older brother, Bob, played basketball every Sunday afternoon. When Bob's friend called him, Jim's brother offered to accompany. Jim's friend asked if Jim would like to go out with his friend. Jim accepted the offer. Bob and Jim had a great time playing basketball.

Bad Cramps. Kerry had been on a very strenuous hike for miles. She was sweating and very excited for the end of the hike. When she started hiking again, she noticed she had cramps. She was sweating and not enjoying her hike anymore. She stopped taking hiking seriously and focused on running instead.
Walking Barefooted. Jake was walking barefooted. His friends tried to get him to run. Jake didn't want to. So he walked to a coffee shop. He bought a fancy coffee with no coffee grounds.
Sara's Cake. Sara was baking a cake. She was making her family's favorite cake. Sara added a new ingredient to the cake. Sara mixed all the ingredients together. Sara's cake turned out great.

Bad but Good Sushi. Tom hated all of the fish in his neighborhood. He hated all of the sauces they put on them. Tom was invited to a sushi bar. Tom tried the best sushi he could and ate it. He was more happy about it afterwards.

Martha's Strict Parents. Martha was always a very strict child. When she was sixteen her parents threatened to stop letting her out. Martha decided she would sneak out of the house and go to the movies. Martha stayed out late and did not want to be caught. Martha's parents caught her sneaking out and she was grounded.

Thrift Store Rookie. Sarah needed to buy a new pair of boots. She had seen an ad for a great pair in the local paper. Sarah was shocked to see them for only $8. The store owner was pleased to see her enthusiasm. Sarah was pleased to buy the boots.

Carousel Barker. The carnival held an open carousel contest. The winner of the contest would win tickets to a circus. The carnival workers lined up at the midway of the ride. The workers put on their costumes and tumbled down the large ride. The workers won tickets to the circus.

Only Blue Pens. My friend Jim was out writing in an old red pen. He lost his red pen and had to go to a grocery store. Jim said his only blue pen was ruined. He said I was a little jealous. I felt sorry for him.
Stuck on top. I was going down the highway. I saw this huge truck. The truck was stuck. I could not get off the highway. I was stuck in the middle.

Mike Soiled His Diaper. Mike was a young toddler. He was playing with his brother's toys. Mike's mom was angry and scolded him. Mike cried, and tried to wash his diaper. Mike's mom scolded him for soiling his diapers.
Rave. Anna went to a rave. She danced all night. She went home early. Anna took a shower. She came out of her shower and decided not to go to the rave again.

The Dog Paw. Ned took his dog for a walk. He noticed a large puddle in the middle of the walk. He ran back to check on his dog. His dog had knocked over the puddle. His dog was wet but had no water at all.

Grill. I went to the market to buy a grill. The prices were very expensive. I didn't want to pay that much money. I decided to grill my food over the summer instead. It worked out much cheaper and I'm glad I did it.

Busted. Tim was in a high school wrestling league. One day Tim went to his first tournament. He got into a fight with another student. The fight was hard fought and Tim got knocked out. Tim tried to go to the next wrestling tournament but he got messed up.

Larry Tries Basketball. Larry was having a lot of fun playing basketball at school. He wanted to play professionally one day. He decided to sign up for the NBA draft. Larry made his NBA team and was offered a contract. He chose to accept the deal and played professionally.
Unsupportive. Kenny was playing football in class. The ball came towards him. However, it ended up hitting him on the head. The whole class looked at Kenny. He was embarrassed.
Dog bite. The dog went into my house to eat my food. After eating my food, it bit me on the arm. The dog didn't stop biting me. I put a bandaid on the bite. The bite turned into a lollipop.
Cookies. I loved making cookies. However, I had a weakness for sugar. I always used too much sugar and burned the cookies. I switched to a peanut butter cookie recipe. The cookies came out delicious!

Needing new glasses. John's eyesight was poor. So John went to the optometrist. The optometrist prescribed him a new prescription. John got his prescription and put in new glasses. Now John's eyesight is better than ever.

Cats. Mary liked to pet her neighbor's cats. Her neighbor asked her to stop but she said no. The neighbor confronted her and asked why. She lied and said that she was trying to pet his cat. The neighbor became so mad that he kicked Mary out of the house.

Power Outage. Toby woke up to the sound of thunder. He turned on the radio and waited for it to stop. Finally, the weather report called for a power outage. Toby got out of bed and went to the breaker box. Toby was relieved to see the power was out!

Party love. John was at the bar with his friends. He was dancing the night away. He decided he wanted to be a DJ for a living. John started a blog and started charging people for his services. He has made more than enough money to retire!

The Missing Tooth. Tara was driving to work one morning. She had just turned a corner and suddenly her front teeth were gone. Tara panicked but quickly realized what had happened. She had turned the corner with her front teeth on the curb. Tara replaced her front teeth with metal ones before she left work.

Not Done. Tim had to do a lot of work for his boss. Tim was very stressed and started to cry. His boss told him to finish up his work. Tim didn't want to but he was afraid to. Tim's boss scolded him and let him go.

The Lock. My mom had a small lock on the front door. I tried to get through it one day. It was stuck. I had to climb through a hole in the front door. I realized I should never try to climb through small locks again.
Good report card. It was the middle of winter. Susie's grade had fallen. So Susie's parents decided to get her a new report card. She was so excited. She turned it in.

New froyo place. Kelly decided to try this new froyo place down the street. She bought a ticket and went inside. She ordered a froyo sandwich. The sandwich was horrible. Kelly decided not to be a froyo fan.

The First Job. Kara just graduated high school. She had applied to work at McDonald's. A few days later she heard that she had got the job. It was a good job for someone her age and in her city. Kara's parents were so proud of her.

Positive Attitude. Bob was on a date at a new restaurant. While at the restaurant, his date left the table with her drink. Bob asked if she can go home. The date told him that she's not going home. Bob felt embarrassed and went back to the table to find her.

School. Tom had a big math test. He had studied all week, but felt unprepared. Tom made sure to drink plenty of water before bed. The next day he tried his best to ace his test. Luckily he got an A on it.
Fussy Cat. My neighbor's cat fussed at me one day. I told him to turn off his radio. He told me he couldn't. He started screaming and trying to hit me. I turned off his radio.
The autobiography. Janet had a secret she was ashamed of. She decided to write an autobiography. She wrote many pages. She took the book to a publisher. The publisher loved it and published it.

Alex. Alex had just moved into a new house with his parents. He was nervous about his first day. But then he met his new best friend, Tom! It turned out that Tom was the kindest kid in school! Alex was so happy that he moved to a new house!

Wounded Bird. Randy was hunting a deer. He took his rifle to the middle of a forest clearing. When Randy tried to shoot a moose, he shot the wrong direction. The rifle bounced and ricocheted off of a tree trunk. The bird's leg wound up being cut off by a large stick.

Milk Trap. My son brought a bottle of water to my work. I told him to put it down and put his hands over it. He thought he would be okay if he did. A cop found the bottle and told him to put it down. He put his hands over it to hide it from the cop.

Painted Nails. Kim was bored and decided to paint her nails. She got some paint from the garage and went to the store. At the store she picked out paint and brushes. When she got home she painted the nails. They looked great!
Small Fire. Tom was cooking dinner. All of a sudden a small fire started. Tom tried to quickly put it out. Unfortunately he couldn't. Tom had to throw out the food and call the fire department.

Career Pains. Irene always felt that she was a great musician. She got a scholarship to a prestigious college, to study music. There, she met many great performers. As a result, Irene decided to become a professional musician. She has now performed all over the world, earning millions of dollars.
Dahlia. My friend's daughter Dahlia has ADHD. Dahlia does not listen well to what her mother says. Her mother is a teacher. Dahlia broke her glasses last week. Dahlia is now on medication.
Raining at pick up. Ivy went to pick up her kid from preschool. But then it rained. The water got in Ivy's car. She had to call a tow truck to get it out of the car. Ivy had to pay a $50 fine.
Grease Burn. Tom was eating out with friends. They ordered fries and chicken strips. Tom accidentally dropped his fries. They landed on his legs and burned a lot. Tom wound up having to go home.

Irrigation. John went for a walk. As he was walking he noticed water everywhere. He had to walk through a very deep puddle. John felt extremely uncomfortable. John put on his pajamas and headed back home.

Pouch. Ben had to go to the store to buy a baseball cap. The clerk in the store informed him that he had already purchased one. Ben felt bad for the clerk. After walking out of the store, he drove home. Ben drove back to the store to buy the cap.

Cartoon. Bill loved cartoons. Bill's friends decided to put him to sleep. Bill woke up and began to cry. Bill's friends took him outside to tell him they were sorry. Bill decided that he didn't like cartoons anymore.
Airplane Food. Tom was on an airplane for the first time. He decided to get food. Tom ordered some pizza and some burgers. Tom loved the pizza. He didn't feel guilty about eating them.

The Castle. The family was visiting Ireland. They found a castle in the countryside. It had an ancient legend about being haunted. They walked around the castle, scared. Then they went home, sad and afraid.

Refreshing Yellow #3 Batch B. The yellow #3 bb was used in all its glory by Billy. He'd get it on his burgers and fries. He had a few different styles that he liked. The best was the fresh bb that would make a big splash. After getting it, he decided to get more of them.

The Museum. The museum had a large collection of old toys. They were stacked up against a big metal detector. The kids were very excited to play with them. The whole family walked around the large exhibit. It was an exciting trip.
Tyler breaks his neck. Tyler is skiing. He is going up the mountain. Tyler hits a rock. He falls to his death. Tyler broke his neck skiing.

Bill Dates Dumb Girls. Bill was having trouble finding a date. He was too picky about his dates. His friend said he should try going to the coffee shop. Bill tried the coffee shop and liked the girls there. Bill was able to make several good dates there.

Late Notice. Sara went to pick up her son from school. The driver told her that her car was not full. Sara felt bad and asked if she could leave. The driver refused. Sara felt bad and decided to stay and pick up her son.

Tammy's Computer Skills. Tammy is an engineer. She works for an electronics company. Recently, Tammy was told to work on her laptop skills. Tammy began working on her laptop skills. She learned a lot about computers.
Sleep. I had my first sleepover last week. I was so excited to spend time with my friends. They were all so funny. The only issue was I couldn't fall asleep. I'll just stay awake forever, though.

Lance. Lance always had an angry and competitive nature. One day, he was playing sports with his friends. He hit another boy and was sent to the office. He was given a long talk with his parents. Afterwards, he was never violent again.
Grocery List. Tom had groceries to get to work. He did not have a grocery list. He did not know how to get to the store. He tried going to a nearby grocery store. He finally found one.

Mailbox Surprise. I got a package in the mail today. It was a box with several envelopes. I opened them and began reading the contents. I received a letter that was not addressed to me. It was addressed to an unknown person who has not yet mailed it.

Basketball Foul. Jerry was playing basketball with his friends. They were all getting a foul. Jerry felt really bad about it. He decided to do something about it. He let his friends know that it was okay and let them win.

Nothing To Talk About. Cathy felt angry and isolated at work. She told her co-workers she was feeling depressed. After a few hours she felt better. Cathy called a co-worker to talk about it. The co-worker laughed at her and didn't respond.

Worst Fear 2. The doctor said the baby needed to be bottle fed. Mom was a big believer in that idea. But the baby was so small, she couldn't handle all the liquid. So she bought a bottle feeder and fed the baby formula. The baby didn't cry - she was so happy!

The Funeral. I attended a funeral last week. It was very emotional to be there. We had no orangutans or any other relatives there. I stayed for two hours just talking with my family. I am not sure I will visit them again.

A girl who loves to Dance. Sylvia has always loved to dance since she was young. She started taking dance lessons and loved them. Her favorite part was the dancing in the park. At her wedding, she wore a shiny gold hoop on her wrist. She was so happy when everyone told her it was a special gift!

Sprinkles. It was summer and my parents didn't like my face. They told me they didn't want me to wear makeup. One day I was eating candy at my friend's house. I was playing in the backyard when I heard sprinkles. The sprinkles made my face look amazing.

Iron Cross. Earl decided to compete in a cross country race. He did really well and got first place. During the next race, Earl hurt his leg. He was unable to run again. He decided not to cross country again.
Rafting. It was a very windy day. Sam went out on his kayak. He wanted to go down a river. When it was time to go down he lost control. His boat tipped and he tumbled out of the water.

Holey jeans. My friend's girlfriend likes to wear denim. She always has long pants and t-shirts. One day she brought an old pair of pants that were too big. I laughed and said it was OK, as long as they fit. She thought it was funny and wore them to work.

The Watch Shop. Kaya wanted a watch for her birthday. Her father didn't have enough money. He decided to get her one on a discount. It cost him two dollars and fifty cents less than he expected! Kaya felt very pleased with her birthday gift.

Dry Lawn. Abe's lawn needed to be watered. But he only had a shovel to use. The neighbor across the street gave Abe a shovel. They went over to Abe's house and dug. Abe's lawn looked better after the yard work.
New Dress. Kelly wanted a new dress. She could not afford to buy one. She decided to sew her own. It was so fun to make her own dress. Kelly was happy to purchase a dress.

A Hot Day. It was a hot day, so my mom turned on the air conditioner. We all sat in the living room, and the heater turned on. Soon, it began to cool down. When she went to put on some more, she noticed her hand was sweating. Afterwards, she put on deodorant and went outside.

Pants. My wife has been trying to get me to change my pants. She says I need to lose some weight. I have not been able to do this. She has tried to talk me into going on diets but I resist. It has been a struggle and I really want to lose weight.

Stay at Home Mom. Bree was having trouble keeping her kids off the computer. Her husband had taken a leave of absence, and was gone most days. One night, she received a message from him, encouraging her to stay home. She went out and bought her own computer, and set it up with cable. She stayed home and relaxed while her kids played video games.

The Security Camera. Gina was asleep. Suddenly her father's watch ran across the room. Her father was looking through the security camera. He caught her in the act. She had to apologize, but it wasn't enough.
Pool Day. John wanted to have fun on a Saturday afternoon. He decided to go to the beach. He swam in the ocean. John got a tan. John decided to go to the beach all weekend.
The test fail. Ida had to take a spelling test for her English class. She was very nervous. She was about to take the test. Suddenly, she heard a pop. She had missed the word she was trying to spell.

Talk Show. Lena was a stand up comedian. She decided to put on a talk show at the local comedy club. Lena was nervous that she'd be heckled. Luckily she performed well. Lena's talk show did a great job!
Chess. Ben played chess online. One day, he played with a stranger. His friend did not know that he was playing online. Ben was embarrassed. He changed his name to Jim.

Goo Rue Food. Sue loved to cook. She decided she wanted to make gourmet Chinese food. After hours of research, Sue chose to make the most rare recipe. She gathered all of the ingredients and began to cook. When she was done, Sue served the dishes to all of her friends.

Doing the Exact Opposite. Eli was trying to change his diet. He decided to eat fewer sweets. He made a plan to do the exact opposite. Every day he would eat exactly as much candy as normal. After a month, Eli had lost over twenty pounds!

Weight loss. Cathy had been at her first weight loss conference for months. She was feeling quite discouraged and decided to pull a fast one. Cathy decided she would have a diet and exercise contest. She trained and ate the food and drank the fluids at the contest. Cathy won the contest and lost 20 pounds in less than a week.

Trip. Tripp went on a trip to the coast with his girlfriend. He left early to see a new place. On the drive home, he got lost. His girlfriend was able to give him directions. Tripp made it back safely.
Swimming. John liked to swim. He wanted to do it for his summer. He asked his parents to let him. John's parents said no. John had to swim in the ocean for a month.
Pregnant. The woman was excited. She had been pregnant for a long time. She had not known how it could be. She called her husband. He agreed to the test.

Summer Reading. In our town there is an annual reading competition. This summer there will be a reading competition for kids. I have been working on a reading of The Catcher of Red Clothes. I am trying to be as quick as I can. I have read a little before it was published.
Job. John wanted to get a new job. He was offered many different positions. Finally, he interviewed with a company. The interview went great. John got the job the next day.

Green Grass. I was taking a walk outside. All of the sudden, a cat ran up and jumped on me. I was so startled I fell backwards. My face landed on the ground and I cried out. I turned around and went home.

The Tattoo. Timmy was about to get his first tattoo. He was nervous, but he decided to get it anyway. He was afraid it would hurt, but he actually liked it. He thought about it for a while and decided to go through with it. When he did it, he loved the intricate design.
A Bounty of Soda. Tom had a drinking problem. He couldn't control his urge to drink. He tried to quit at first. It wasn't enough. He decided to start vending instead.

I'm a Bad Goalie. I watched my friend's soccer game. I was so mesmerized that I wasn't paying attention. The goalie got the ball in the goal and it flew into the goal. The goalie got a red card and the team was disbanded. I haven't watched any soccer since.
Suspension. John was playing football with his friends. He was tackled hard and hurt his leg. His friend told John to stay down. John was suspended for fighting. John was very angry at his friend.

Cops. A man with a black eye and a crooked tooth was walking home from work. All the kids wanted to give him money and so he began to smile. A cop pulled him over, looking for a fake ID. The man explained he had no ID and that he'd never worn it. The cop let the man go because he didn't have a criminal record.
Ramen. Jim wanted to lose weight. He realized his diet wasn't working. Jim decided to order Chinese take out. Jim ordered a huge order of Ramen. He was glad he could save his money.

Loose Cage. Jim had a large cage that he didn't know how to close. So he borrowed a large box and tried to close it. He was a bit too stubborn and the cage broke through a piece of wood. Jim had to borrow a large saw from a friend and had to cut the wood down. Luckily Jim was able to use a small saw and closed the cage.

Bike Race. Jim and his friends were riding bikes down a hill. All of a sudden, Jim lost control of the bike. He was thrown off and fell down the hill. Jim's bike crashed into a tree. Jim felt horrible that he messed up his first bike race.

The New Drink. I was in the backseat of a car. It was my favorite drink. Suddenly, the driver was arguing with his passenger. He yelled at her to get out or else he'd never drive again. The driver apologized, and I had to drink my new favorite drink.

Hunter. My dad bought me a hunting book when I was three years old. I didn't want to read it because it was very violent. I was very active and did not have any time for it. When I was ten, I went hunting with my dad. I found my first deer and it was a very satisfying experience.

Angel at Work. Angel was a secretary at a bank. One day she came into work extremely late. The manager was furious at Angel. The manager decided to fire Angel. Angel was devastated by the termination.
The Game. The school was playing a game. It was a football game. The team did very well. Their team won! They all celebrated the win.

Problem Solver. A man was having troubles with a computer problem. He tried to troubleshoot it but to no avail. He decided to take it to a repairman. The repairman charged him a hundred dollars to fix the computer. Now, the man has a functioning computer.

Sara's New Friend. Sara decided to bring her dog home from the shelter. Her dog loved going to the park. One day, Sara's dog ran off. Sara went out searching for her dog. Sara's dog was nowhere to be found.
Wedding Day. Linda was nervous. She was marrying her boyfriend. When the wedding day came she was shaking. Her nerves disappeared. Linda got married.
Car Wash. Tina was driving home from work. She noticed a car wash. When she got home she washed the car. She took it to the car wash. She got compliments on it.

First Day of School. When I was in kindergarten, I was scared to go to class. I was scared that I would be bullied because I was tall and thin. One day, the principal came up to me and gave me a big hug. She told me that I was very brave that day. She even gave me some candy after that day!

Wish. My friend Jim was talking about wishing that his parents weren't so strict. He asked me if I would ever wish that they weren't so strict. I didn't think about it too much. Then a week later I wished for Jim to be home at night instead of at work. I wish that Jim didn't work so hard so I can relax with my friend.

Sleepover. Last weekend my family and I decided to sleepover. We played board games and watched movies. We even ordered pizza that night. At one point we went to bed without eating, which was a big mistake. We were awake until 3 am when we finally ate.

Pilates. Alyssa really wanted to lose some weight. She took up a few different classes in her gym. She was tired of the treadmill for many months. She went back to running on her own and had a great workout. She was proud of herself for trying something new.
The Canal. Amy's family went to the canal. They walked along the canal for hours. Amy was bored. She decided to go home. Amy had a great time talking to her family.
Test. Randy was working on a test. He was really concentrating on it. Suddenly, he had to run out of time. Randy tried to explain it but the teacher wasn't satisfied. The teacher gave him an F.

Shut Down. Amy walked to school one morning. She ran across the main hall. At the top of the stairs she saw the fire alarm. She called out for help as she saw a small fire burning. Luckily, no one was hurt as the alarm was set off by her.

Need A Ride. A man wanted to call his friend. The friend was out of town for the weekend. He would not answer the phone. The man decided to call his friend in person. He was able to get a ride back to his house.

The Girl Scout. Daphne wanted to join the girl scouts. Daphne had to wait two weeks for the letter from the scoutmaster. She had been waiting on the letter for two days. The letter came a day before the girl scouts were to meet in a park. Daphne walked out with a new friend.
Bought new sheets. I decided to buy new sheets. I went to the store to get some. I decided on one sheet that had free shipping. When I got home I turned them on. They worked great.
The Haircut. Sandra wanted a haircut. She went to her stylist. Her stylist cut her hair perfectly. Sandra loved her new haircut. She wore her new haircut the next day.

Marco's Big Goal. Marco wanted to become a professional wrestler. He trained for many months before joining the team. He practiced hard every day. His first match was against a famous pro wrestler. Marco defeated him and became a professional wrestler.

The Glass Bottle. Ana dropped a glass bottle when she was going to wash dishes. She couldn't find the bottle anywhere. She found it under her bed and thought about taking a look. She peeked under the bed and saw the bottle. Ana laughed, realizing it wasn't the one she dropped.

Weird Channel. Sam was trying to watch the news. He was on the wrong channel. He tried to look around for another one. Sam kept trying to find the right one. Eventually he got back on the correct one.
Trash. Our neighbors had trash cans left over. It was Sunday. It was late at night. It was very cold out. They put their trash away.

Shiny Red. Kate wanted a new watch. She had been saving up for weeks. The last day was the day she could finally buy it. She was able to pick out a really shiny red watch. Kate was so happy to finally have a watch.

One shot. We decided to play card games last night. We decided to play Scrabble. We both thought it would be fun. We played one game and ended up drawing. We decided it would be a good idea to play more often.
